Articles.Content:
I've been planning and building a manned science mission to both Duna and Ike. Since I want to do all the possible science experiments on both bodies, I would either have to bring two mystery goo and material bays, or haul the lab. I really don't see why we need a 3.5 tonne part to reuse experiments, since all you are really doing is scrubbing the parts down and putting a new set of paint cans/goo blob in the part.

Therefore I suggest that two new parts be added: a canister of spare mystery goo blobs and a canister of spare paint cans. You could use the tweakables to adjust how many spares are in a canister, and it would allow a player to reuse experiments without needing a 3.5 tonne part that needs two crew to even use (you would still need one Kerbal to EVA out, grab a paint can/goo blob from the spare experiments canister, and put it in the experiment part).

The disadvantage being that it doesn't hold any crew, experiments, or an infinite amount of new experiments.

Radially Attached Experimental Data Storage Container: http://forum.kerbalspaceprogram.com/threads/54370-Radially-Attached-Experimental-Data-Storage-Container

Works perfectly in 0.23. I use it too.
I wonder what happened to that toolbox part shown off a while ago? That could've been useful for hauling up spare experiment equipment.
Yes. Yes. All. My. Yes. To. This. Suggestion.
